bug.short_desc: Improve error message when change event is missing

long_desc.thetext:
At the moment, if one tries to bind from or to an object which does not have the appropriate change event, one gets a rather cryptic error message:
"uncaught exception: No event could be found for the property: datasource"
without any other information on the source of the error. One doesn't even know this has to do with databinding.
Suggested fix: Provide detailed information such as "Cannot bind object X, property chain X.X to object Y, property chain Y.Y: event Z is missing on source/target"
Sounds like a good idea. To me.

Adding to this - in general, error messages in databinding are difficult to interpret because they are often thrown very low-level ( for example, when array or objects don't have the expected structure. It would be good if there was a hight-level sanity check in place which would tell the user in advance if databinding can take place as expressed in the given property chains or why it cannot work, specifying the targets and property chains, so the problem can be found in the code. Thanks.

Improved the error message. I tried to be as specific as I could in without changing the whole method parameters only for the error case. The message now looks something like this:
